section.name: Overview
section.p: Checkstyle can generate XML, SARIF and plain text reports of its findings.

section.name: Description
section.p: The source attribute of the error tag contains the fully qualified class name of the check that generated the violation.
When a custom ID is provided for a check, the format becomes: source="fully.qualified.ClassName#customId"

section.name: Xml report
section.p:
The XML report schema is available at:
checkstyle-report-1.0.0.xsd
Use this schema to validate XML output from Checkstyle's report generation.
Below is an example of a Checkstyle XML report:

pre.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <checkstyle version="10.0"> <file name="com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java"> <error line="1" column="1" severity="error" message="Missing package-info.java file." source="com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.coding.MissingPackageInfoCheck"/> </file> </checkstyle>
